result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell Ryan Engebretson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mitchell Ryan Engebretson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mitchell Ryan Engebretson was found guilty of Burglary-Room w/in Building, etc. [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(f).
  • Mitchell Ryan Engebretson was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall pay court costs to DOC.
Defendant shall pay restitution to DOC. Court authorizes DOC to withhold prison wages for restitution.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling and programming as DOC deems appropriate. 
Defendant shall not possess or consumer any controlled substances unless prescribed and  to be taken only as prescribed.
Defendant shall not have any contact with victims or their premises. 
Defendant shall be subject to random observed testing for the presence of controlled substances.

Defendant shall be employed full time at 40 hours a week. If not employed defendant shall seek work at a rate of no less than 3 job applications per week. If interview is offered to attend that interview or explain why the interview was not attended.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: prison and extended supervision sentences in 22CF07, 22CF46, and 22CF54.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

Defendant shall not possess or consumer any controlled substances unless prescribed and to be taken only as prescribed.
Defendant shall not have any contact with victims or their premises. 
Defendant shall be subject to random observed testing for the presence of controlled substances.
Defendant shall pay restitution directly to DOC.

Defendant shall be employed full time at 40 hours a week. If not employed defendant shall seek work at a rate of no less than 3 job applications per week. If interview is offered to attend that interview or explain why the interview was not attended.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mitchell Ryan Engebretson

records.addlTxt: Partial Transcript of Plea and Sentencing Hearing held May 25, 2022

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mitchell Ryan Engebretson in court, in custody at Grant County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Mitchell Ryan Engebretson. Per agreement, defendant will be pleading to Cts 1 and 3. State will move to dismiss Cts 2 and 4. State will be recommending  2 years prison (1in and 1out) for Ct 1 and probation for 2 years for Ct 3 to run consecutive to the prison sentence with the following conditions: random drug testing, to participate in counseling, to pay restitution, not to have any contact with victims or their premises, defendant shall be employed full time at 40 hours a week. If not employed defendant shall seek work at a rate of no less than 3 job applications per week. If interview is offered to attend that interview or explain why the interview was not attended. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads guilty to Cts 1 and 3. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of Cts 1 and 3. Cts 2 and 4 are dismissed per agreement. Court reviews rights lost due to felony conviction. State heard. Attorney Bartelt heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 2 years WSPS (1in and 1 out) for Ct 1 consecutive to current sentence currently serving and 2 years probation for Ct 3. Conditions of extended supervision and probation are: to have such assessment, treatment, counseling, and programming as directed by DOC, not to possess or consume any controlled substance except those prescribed and to be taken only as prescribed, to pay restitution, to have no contact with any of the victims or their premises, submit to random observed testing to the presence of controlled substance, to be employed full time at 40 hours a week and if not employed full time seek work at a rate of no less that 3 job applications per week, if interview is offered to attend that interview or explain why the interview was not attended, court costs on Ct 1 and waived on Ct 3, and restitution.

Defendant Mitchell Ryan Engebretson appeared by video, in custody at Grant County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Mitchell Ryan Engebretson. Status continued.
Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on May 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on March 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Mitchell Ryan Engebretson appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Peter A. Bartelt appeared in court for Mitchell Ryan Engebretson, Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Joshua Grabandt sworn and testifies. Exhibit #1 Report-marked, offered and received. Cross. Court reviews exhibit. Arguments heard. Court finds probable cause to bind over for trial. Information filed. Defendant waives reading and stands mute. Not guilty pleas entered. Status and trial weeks set.
Status conference scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on March 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 25, 2022 at 10:15 am.

DA Lisa Riniker appeared in person for prosecution. Defendant appeared by phone from Grant County Jail. Court explains charges, penalties and right to counsel. Defendant is on a probation hold. Defendant referred to SPD. State requests $500 cash bond. Court sets bond at $500 cash. Status as to counsel set.
Status conference on January 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Initial appearance on January 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
